thread.title: Woman shares real truth behind her stunning Instagram bikini photo
thread.title_full: Woman shares real truth behind her stunning Instagram bikini photo

author: Joshua Barrie
title: Woman shares real truth behind her stunning Instagram bikini photo
text:
Woman shares real truth behind her stunning Instagram bikini photo It's a powerful and necessary message Share There's more to people than one image (Photo: Twitter / annavictoria) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A woman has captured the realities of the human body in a provocative Instagram snap. Because the truth is, social media can be hugely deceptive. 
Social media star and fitness blogger Anna Victoria was inspired by an online campaign to reveal the 'truth' behind photos. 
Anna has more than one million followers. She looks the very epitome of fitness and health. But her latest inspiration is showing thousands of women that she's actually more 'normal' than her images usually portray. 
In the left, Anna is seen looking incredibly slim. She's slim on the right, too, but her figure is clearly a little different. Or looks it, anyway. https://www.instagram.com/p/BPV9-cUA09D/embed 
"Me 1 per cent of the time vs. 99 per cent of the time," Anna writes. 
"And I love both photos equally. Good or bad angles don't change your worth. I recently came across an article talking about how one woman stated she refuses to accept her flaws, because she doesn't see them as flaws at all." 
The woman Anna came across is called Gina, who's also a health blogger. Gina campaigns for people who suffer from eating disorders. 
Gina started #embracethesquish â€“ showing that women are all different, and angles, light, even time of day all play a part in body image. Everyone is beautiful in their own way is the message. https://www.instagram.com/p/BPWCkv0AEsC/embed 
Thousands of women have embraced the trend and are posting their own pictures. 
All this is important, especially at a time where young, often vulnerable people are susceptible to misguided and fabricated ideals. Social media doesn't always paint the real picture, basically. Here are some more...
